unexpected IT emergencies

title: Network Administrator
description: With 200 attorneys from offices in Baton Rouge, New Orleans, Lafayette, Lake Charles, Shreveport, Houston and The Woodlands, Kean Miller serves the legal needs of the people, businesses, and industries that drive the regional economy. Our people provide creative solutions, unique strategies, and unparalleled value that allow our clients to perform at the highest level. Kean Miller has an opening for a Network Administrator to work in our Baton Rouge office. Job Description Supporting network equipment including routers, proxy servers, switches, WAN accelerators, DNS and DHCP Provides documentation and technical specifications to Technology team for planning and implementing changes to infrastructure Provides daily system monitoring to verify integrity and availability of all systems Evaluates system performance and recommends upgrades or changes as needed Responds to and remediates any security incidents Implements, maintains, and verifies backup processes for data protection, disaster recovery, and failover procedures Configuring firewalls, routing, and switching to maximize network efficiency and security Perform system vulnerability and patch management for server, network, and storage devices Implements automated solutions as needed for process improvement including, but not limited to, scripting and configuration management tools Manage and maintain cloud telephony and unified communication systems Utilize monitoring software to ensure timely response to network and systems issues Performs account and system auditing as assigned Configures and maintains SSO and two-factor authentication methods across systems Administers on-call and after-hours server maintenance on a rotating basis and unscheduled emergency situations as needed Required Technical Knowledge Understanding of the concepts of network infrastructure Configuration and support of Windows Server 2016 or higher Firewall and switch configuration and management Active Directory and office 365 management knowledge Group Policy management Strong knowledge of Microsoft 365 platform management VMWare virtualization management Citrix infrastructure management Microsoft Office 365, including Teams, SharePoint, and OneDrive administration Security best practices in relation to email, web filtering, and user education Experience with service ticket systems (IQTrack, ServiceNow, ConnectWise, etc.) Required Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree preferred Minimum 5 years of prior experience Critical thinking skills Strong troubleshooting and analytical problem-solving skills Strong documentation skills Understanding of basic project management processes Good communication skills – both written and verbal What Kean Miller Offers Kean Miller provides its employees with competitive salaries and a full paid benefits package, a great work environment, stability, generous paid-time off and contributes to a 401k plan. Kean Miller values the strength that comes from a diverse and inclusive workplace. We know that prioritizing diversity, equity, and inclusion contributes to the success of our people and helps us provide superior service to our clients. We have received external recognition of our diverse, welcoming workplace by Diversity Lab through our Mansfield Certification achievement. How to Apply Please email a confidential resume to hr@keanmiller.com . The Firm is committed to providing equal employment opportunity to all applicants and employees in full compliance with all applicable state, federal, and local laws and strictly prohibits, and does not tolerate, discrimination against employees, applicants, and others based upon race, color, sex (including pregnancy and pregnancy-related conditions), national origin or ancestry, ethnicity, age, disability, gender identity, transsexual status, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, religion, creed, genetic tests or genetic information, sickle cell trait, or any other status, characteristic, or activity protected by applicable law. This applies to all aspects of employment including recruitment, hiring, promotion, transfer, demotion, discipline, and discharge.

title: IT Technician
description: Description *$5,000 Referral Bonus* View details here: https://www.leidos.com/careers/erp The Defense Group of Leidos currently has an opening for an IT Specialist Senior to support execution of projects on the NGEN-R SMIT contract and to be located in New Orleans, LA. The IT Specialist Senior will oversee operation of network systems, architecture, and topology through deployment and oversight of network operations specialists. The qualified candidate will also perform asset scanning and logging of assets that have been delivered in accordance with established Government directives for both Lab and Production assets. Other duties and responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Perform advanced systems installation, operation, integration, and troubleshooting in order to maintain optimum Information Technology (IT) system operations. Design and oversee upgrades and new installs of IT systems and services ensuring coordination with Cyber Security Specialist. Perform Tier III upgrades of networking systems, IT systems, and storage networking. Perform Tier III troubleshooting, optimization, and performance management of Internet Protocol (IP), Domain Name System (DNS), Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP), and routing protocols. Integrate enterprise, regional, and local IT systems ensuring current network operations are sustained or oversee their recovery. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, MIS, Business, or related field At minimum, ten years of IT experience including Internet Protocol version 6 (IPv6), Enhanced Interior Gateway Routing Protocol (EIGRP), Border Gateway Protocol (BGP), Virtual Local Area Networks (VLANs), Virtual Private Networks (VPNs), and Network Address Translation (NAT). Must possess an Information Assurance Technician (IAT) Level II and a MDAE - Certified Microsoft 365 Modern Desktop Administrator Expert Certification. US Citizen with an active DOD Secret clearance SMIT-MCEN ECSfeatured Pay Range: Pay Range $87,100.00 - $157,450.00 The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. Additional factors considered in extending an offer include (but are not limited to) responsibilities of the job, education, experience, knowledge, skills, and abilities, as well as internal equity, alignment with market data, applicable bargaining agreement (if any), or other law. Original Posting Date: 12/21/2023 While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.

title: IT Support
description: Description: The Amivero Team Amivero’s team of IT professionals delivers digital services that elevate the federal government, whether national security or improved government services. Our human-centered, data-driven approach is focused on truly understanding the environment and the challenge, and reimagining with our customer how outcomes can be achieved. Our team of technologists leverage modern, agile methods to design and develop equitable, accessible, and innovative data and software services that impact hundreds of millions of people. As a member of the Amivero team you will use your empathy for a customer’s situation, your passion for service, your energy for solutioning, and your bias towards action to bring modernization to very important, mission-critical, and public service government IT systems. Special Requirements Must travel to the office in Shreveport daily US Citizenship Required to obtain Public Trust Clearance High School Diploma and min of 4 years of relevant experience in an IT related field The Gist... We are looking for an IT Professional to assist the IT Manager in performing a variety of tasks associated with the day-to-day operations and administration of IT systems within a law office. These duties include a wide range of IT support to meet the office's information needs using network hardware and software capabilities Requirements: What Your Day Might Include… Assist in the planning and delivery of customer support services at the point of computer user/specialist interface, including installation, configuration, troubleshooting, customer assistance, and/or training. Provide IT customer service via troubleshooting, recovering, and resolving recurring software/hardware problems. Provide user training and assistance on a variety of routine apps. Provide wide variety of technical support services to coordinate teleconferences and distance learning activities to effectively deliver legal training using electronic and/or telecom media. Install, configure, upgrade and troubleshoot commonly used hardware and software systems within the organization. Distribute and install new or upgraded software to ensure customers receive current versions of supported software. Follow established procedures for data recovery and preservation of electronic evidence when unauthorized operations have occurred to include reporting procedures. Assist customers and clients in identifying and describing IT requirements for business and legal applications. Install, configure, and maintain equipment used for litigation support Primary point of contact for user issues like break, fix and all concerns related to IT You’ll Bring These Qualifications… High School Diploma and min of 4 years of relevant experience in an IT related field Must have experience with ticketing systems such as: Remedy, ServiceNow etc. Experience with SCCM/MECM, Webex, Zoom, Eclipse, SolarWinds, Office 365, Cloud Service, USAVoice, Splunk, Aruba, Active Directory, Microsoft Exchange, SharePoint Must have ability to prioritize tasks and have great time management skills EOE/M/F/VET/DISABLED All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. Amivero complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

title: IT Technician
description: Position- Health IT Service Associate Job Location- Shreveport, Louisiana Compensation- based on skills and experience General Job Description Under general supervision and established policies and procedures, the Scanning Specialist will be responsible for day-to-day administrative functions in support of efficient and effective patient care, including indexing all medical and administrative records. Requirements · Ability to work in a fast-paced environment · Computer proficiency and prior experience with Electronic Medical Records preferred. Job Responsibilities: · Scans and indexes patient documents and tasks clinical personnel as appropriate. · Assists with training activities as needed. · Maintains accuracy and productivity levels as established by department standards. · Performs, organizes, and streamlines operational tasks to reduce potential errors. WORK EXPERIENCE · Minimum 1-3 years of relevant record scanning Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract Schedule: 8 hour shift Day shift Monday to Friday Experience: Medical Record Scanning: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: In person

title: Senior IT Specialist
description: Looking for a qualified individual with a strong IT background, time management, and excellent verbal/written communication and analytical skills to join a growing team of IT Professionals specializing in providing managed IT services to small and medium sized businesses. This position requires solving problems and making routine decisions. The ideal candidate will have some IT based certifications and experience and be willing to attain additional competencies once joining our team. Benefits: Being a part of the strongest and fastest-growing IT networking company in the region. Working in a fun, energetic, and team-oriented work environment. Our commitment to helping you grow professionally with training and career advancement opportunities including certification testing support, training, and reimbursement. Competitive salary and benefits package including 100% employer paid medical at the employee level, cafeteria plan with options for vision, dental, & disability plans, generous PTO and holiday offerings, 401(k) Plan with company match and profit sharing. Limited on-call hours for technical employees. Social events and volunteering opportunities inside and outside the office. Additional Details We are seeking an IT Support Specialist (Tier 1/Tier 2) to join our quickly growing Managed Service team. Ability to multi-task and prioritize projects. Ability to work well in a team environment involving collaboration within the department and with other departments. Knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Office 365 implementation and support Familiarity with administration of various Firewalls, Switches and Wireless Access Points along with Cyber Security technical knowledge Experience managing backups, disaster recovery, and business continuity Manage day-to-day tickets, assigned projects and any additional responsibilities as assigned. Perform analysis, diagnosis, and resolution of PC/Server problems either on-site or via remote access. Receive and respond to incoming calls, help desk tickets, and/or emails regarding PC and/or hardware problems. Work with end-users in analyzing, troubleshooting, and resolving hardware/software and some basic network support issues. Communicate with customers to keep them apprised on the status of requests. Research and resolve problems. Accurately document instances of hardware failure, repair, installation, and removal. Ensure confidentiality of sensitive and proprietary information; adhere to company security policies. Develop an understanding for system environments and maintain technical expertise. Provide quality customer care in a fast and efficient manner. Ability to occasionally work outside normal business hours. Must have a valid driver’s license with no restrictions. Highly responsive and sensitive to deadlines. Follow-up and follow through. Qualifications: Preferred candidates for this role will have: 2+ years of experience in the support of a variety of Microsoft networks for small and mid-size businesses. Associates or Bachelors degree in Information Technology or have equivalent IT support experience, certifications, and/or training. Relative industry certifications including: CompTIA (Network+, Security+) (Preferred) Microsoft and Azure Windows certifications (MCSA, MCSE, MCP) Familiarity with ConnectWise or similar ticketing system for time and record keeping. Excellent customer service skills and initiative to go the extra mile for our clients and team members. Work Remotely No Job Type: Full-time Pay: $16.00 - $53.00 per hour Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Health insurance Health savings account Life insurance Paid time off Professional development assistance Relocation assistance Retirement plan Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday On call Education: High school or equivalent (Preferred) Experience: Help desk: 1 year (Preferred) Windows: 1 year (Preferred) Work Location: In person

title: Information Technology Manager
description: IT MANAGER Job Purpose The IT Coordinator is responsible for organization-wide systems and information. The IT Coordinator position oversees all hardware, program and network related tasks, problems, and solutions within the company. Duties and Responsibilities Help define and manage company data and infrastructure architecture and processes. Conducting routine evaluations of network and data security Identifying and acting on opportunities to improve and update software and systems. Oversee procurement and deployment of new hardware (tablets, laptops, phones, etc.), retrieve hardware from past users and maintain inventory. Maintain phone system and program/delete users as needed. Create, implement, and train employees on a company IT policy and best practices. Determines timeframe and oversees major IT projects including system updates, upgrades, migrations, and outages. Train employees to use project management software and other systems the company uses to function; troubleshoot issues and provide technical support when needed. Develop and execute disaster planning and maintain data backups. Troubleshoot hardware and software issues related to internal IT. Assess and manage vendor relationships, make determinations on vendor selection, and serve as coordinator between company and all 3rd party vendor managed services. Qualifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill and/or ability required. Qualifications include: High School Diploma or equivalent preferred Valid U.S. Driver’s License 2-5 years of experience working in IT operations Excellent working knowledge of computer systems, security, network and systems administration, databases and data storage systems, and phone systems Strong critical thinking and decision-making skills. Deep knowledge of programming languages and operating systems (ex: Microsoft Exchange, Active Directory), current equipment and technologies, enterprise backup and recovery procedures, and systems performance monitoring. Preferred qualifications: Associate degree (or equivalent) in information technology or computer science Professional certification Working Conditions Frequently working in office settings. Occasionally, working in outside environments. Some travel, overnight stays may be required to remote office locations and jobsites. Could work outside normal operating hours as needed during system maintenance periods as to not interrupt normal business. Physical Requirements Lift up to 50lbs

title: Windows Server Administrator
description: Description: NexGen Data Systems (NGDS) is seeking a Windows Server Administrator. This role is entrusted with the responsibility of ensuring strict adherence to security policies and organizational values in all aspects related to Data Center, operating systems, software systems, and associated procedures. This position demands a robust technical skill set, encompassing the ability to contribute to the design, implementation, and documentation of Microsoft Windows operating systems. Furthermore, it entails proficiency in various technological domains, including virtualization, networking, application configuration, and seamless integration with other critical components of data center infrastructure such as databases, SANs, and monitoring software. The ideal candidate should exhibit a desire for learning emerging technologies and must not confine their expertise solely to Microsoft Windows operating systems. This will be a hybrid position, requiring candidates to be local or relocate to Charleston, SC. Roles and Responsibilities: Oversight of a Windows Server 2019/2016 domain spanning multiple geographical locations, with an emphasis on sustaining uninterrupted operations. Pioneering the conception of innovative solutions aimed at enhancing domain functionality. Demonstrated proficiency as a self-initiating professional with a track record of successful infrastructure design, administration, and leadership, particularly in roles of high visibility. Aptitude and experience in integrating or designing Windows systems within an AWS Cloud architecture. Expertise in Group Policy Objects (GPO) design, security hardening, and maintaining compliance with DISA STIG standards. Comfortable functioning in a dynamic, hands-on role while actively engaging in testing and experimentation with cutting-edge technologies as they emerge. Provision of support for systems engineering planning, architectural analysis, trade analysis, systems design, and sustainment activities, particularly for customer systems. Deployment of technical Subject Matter Expertise (SME) across system and Joint C4I systems and programs, aligning with industry best practices. Application of proficiency in relevant technologies and protocols, including the critical evaluation of candidate system production architectures, program implementation plans, test plans, test results, site integration requirements, and integrated logistics support plans and policies, particularly concerning modernization initiatives. Provision of on-site installation support by meticulously adhering to application configuration guidelines and implementation plans, ensuring the seamless configuration of system applications during installation, configuration, testing, scanning, software updates, patching, and resolution of trouble tickets. Installation, configuration, upgrading, and maintenance of Microsoft Windows Server 2019/2016 environments. Efficient deployment of applications within a Windows Server 2019/2016 environment. Expert utilization of Active Directory Domain services for Windows Server 2019/2016, encompassing domain Group Policy Objects (GPOs) and domain administration. Conducting daily system monitoring, encompassing the verification of hardware and server resource integrity, system functionality, and essential processes. This includes a thorough review of system and application logs and verification of scheduled job completions such as backups. Diligent execution of regular security monitoring to promptly identify and address any potential security intrusions. Provision of comprehensive testing and evaluation support, including technical contributions to test request forms and IV&V (Independent Verification and Validation) test plans. Actively participating in and supporting testing and evaluation events. Offering Tier III and other support services in response to requests from various stakeholders, with a focus on meticulous issue investigation and troubleshooting. Proficiency in rapid recovery from hardware or software failures, with effective coordination and communication with affected stakeholders. Regular application of OS patches and upgrades, along with administrative tool and utility enhancements and configurations of new services as deemed necessary. Maintenance of operational procedures, configuration records, and other essential documentation. Periodic performance reporting to support capacity planning and the implementation of ongoing performance tuning, hardware upgrades, and resource optimization measures as required, including the configuration of CPU, memory, and disk partitions to meet operational demands. Other Duties: Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice. Requirements: Desired/Required Skills: Microsoft Certified Systems Administrator (MCSA) or Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer (MCSE) – preferred. 8+ years’ experience with Windows server (2003, 2008, 2012) platforms. 8+ years’ experience with Windows Security Templates, Configuration and Analysis. 8+ years’ experience with Windows Active Directory including Group Policy Object (GPO) usage. Exposure to and familiarity with data center design including systems, storage, and networking. A strong sense of urgency including self-governance on task priority. Ability to interpret and/or discuss information with others, which involves terminology or concepts not familiar to many people; provide advice and recommend actions involving rather complex issues; resolve problems within established practices. Ability to keep current on DoD/DoN and industry trends while working independently and as part of a team. Bachelor of Science degree in Electrical/Electronic Engineering or Computer Science/Information Systems Technology Six (6) years of experience with engineering within Enterprise Hosting Environments to include experience with: Systems Analysis, Systems Architecture, Systems/Equipment Support, Test and Evaluation, or Logistics support of C4ISR requirements. Three (3) years of technical experience in support of Enterprise Hosting. Experience may be achieved simultaneously. OR Technical Training in relevant enterprise hosting technology areas Ten (10) years of hands-on experience with Enterprise Hosting or similar projects, to include three (3) of the following five (5) areas: Systems Requirements, Operational Requirements, Data Analysis, Test & Evaluation, and Training. Experience may be achieved simultaneously Recognized expert who has demonstrated industry and/or public service (Department of Defense) leadership in Information Technology, Architecture or Engineering 8570 Compliance required (Security and OS Certification). Active Secret or higher Government Clearance Required. About the Company: NexGen Data Systems is an emerging technologies focused company providing expert systems and network engineering solutions to the Department of Defense. NexGen Data Systems promotes a culture of knowledge and career advancement through continued learning, keeping our team current on the latest advances in systems and networking, and enabling our team to provide the best available solutions to our clients. Benefits: Company covers 100% of premiums for the employee’s medical, dental, and vision insurance and subsidizes premiums for spouse and dependents. Company provides short and long term disability plans. 401(k) match up to 10% of the employee’s salary contributions to 401(K) plan. Comprehensive training and development program. 11 paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) accrual level starts at 15 days annually. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status. NOTE: US Citizens and those authorized to work in the US are encouraged to apply. In order to be qualified for this position, you must be able to obtain and maintain a United States Department of Defense (DoD) security clearance. We are unable to sponsor Visas at this time. NexGen Data Systems provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

title: Systems Administrator
description: About Us: Louisiana State University of Alexandria is a publicly supported institution that provides undergraduate level college education to the citizens of Central Louisiana. The university is a unit of the LSU System and operates under the auspices of the Louisiana Board of Regents. LSUA is located in Rapides Parish. All Job Postings will close at 12:01a.m. CST (1:01a.m. EST) on the specified Closing Date (if designated). If you close the browser or exit your application prior to submitting, the application progress will be saved as a draft. You will be able to access and complete the application through “My Draft Applications” located on your Candidate Home page. Job Posting Title: Library Systems Administrator Position Type: Professional / Unclassified Department: LSUA ASA - LA - Library (Lillian Mauldin Purdy (00079755)) Work Location: LSU - Alexandria Pay Grade: Professional Job Description: Job Title: Library Systems Administrator Department: Library Services Position Type: Staff, professional twelve-month Reports To: Director of Library Services Primary Responsibilities Administer integrated library systems, content management systems, and discovery interfaces Load, maintain, and analyze all electronic resources; including, but not limited to: e-books, e-journals, and databases Analyze all library resources and usage, and report as needed to support collection management and all library operations Serve as the LOUIS System Administrator Serve as a library liaison to select academic departments Serve as the library’s liaison to Institutional Research and Effectiveness and furnish statistical data on request Responsible for computer hardware and software selection, installation, and troubleshooting Responsible for access terms and contracts for electronic/digital materials Serve as systems administrator for local digitization and digital library development As needed, provide training and/or quality control to library faculty and staff Work as team player with the library faculty and staff to develop policies and to provide excellent library service Serve as the library liaison to the Informational Education Technology (IET) Department Administer the library webpages Create library impact statements for new and revised courses Attend conferences and workshops to stay informed on system related issues Create and post tutorials and guides on library webpage Creation and advanced editing of media for the purposes of instruction and promotion Occasionally design and conduct library instruction sessions Occasionally staff the reference desk Represent the library on faculty senate and administrative campus-wide committees as needed Supervise support staff and student workers as needed Work evenings and weekends as needed Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in a field related to Library and Information Science or Computer Information Systems and two years’ work experience in a related field Preferred Qualifications Master’s degree in Library and Information Science from an ALA accredited program. Experience with supporting an integrated library system or discovery service or other library or collection management systems Knowledge of library standards, including MARC and XML Experience with SirsiDynix Symphony Experience with library cataloging and/or acquisitions experience Working knowledge of various technologies used in library automation systems, such as EZproxy, MarcEdit, OpenURL link resolvers, OCLC WorldCat Working knowledge of one or more general programming languages: PHP, Python, Perl, JavaScript Working knowledge of XML and XSLT, particularly library specific applications such as MARCXML, MODS, Dublin Core Working knowledge of web technologies, such as HTML, CSS, content management systems Competencies Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills Ability to prioritize and multi-task Ability to learn and apply new technologies Ability to work in a highly collaborative, team-based environment Excellent interpersonal, communication, and organizational skills Additional Job Description: Special Instructions: Application Instructions: Please attach a Resume/CV, a cover letter, 3 references and unofficial transcripts. Official transcripts will be required upon hire. Posting Date: November 15, 2023 Closing Date (Open Until Filled if No Date Specified): Additional Position Information: Background Check - An offer of employment is contingent on a satisfactory pre-employment background check. Benefits - LSUA offers outstanding benefits to eligible employees and their dependents including health, life, dental, and vision insurance; flexible spending accounts; retirement options; various leave options; paid holidays; wellness benefits; tuition exemption for qualified positions; training and development opportunities; employee discounts; and more! Remote Work - Positions approved to work remotely outside the State of Louisiana shall be employed through Louisiana State University’s partner, nextSource Workforce Solutions, for Employer of Record Services including but not limited to employment, benefits, payroll, and tax compliance. Positions employed through Employer of Record Services will be offered benefits and retirement as applicable through their provider and will not be eligible for State of Louisiana benefits and retirement. Essential Position (Y/N): LSUA is an Equal Opportunity Employer and SAME Agency: LSUA believes diversity, equity, and inclusion enrich the educational experience of our students, faculty, and staff, and are necessary to prepare all people to thrive personally and professionally in a global society. We celebrate diversity and are committed to the principles of diversity and inclusion. We actively seek and encourage qualified applications from persons with diverse backgrounds, cultures and experiences. To learn more about how LSUA is committed to diversity and inclusivity, please see LSUA’s Diversity Statement . LSUA is also designated as a State As a State Model Employer (SAME) agency and provides assistance to persons needing accommodations or with the accessibility of materials. For those seeking such accommodations or assistance with the accessibility of materials related to this search are encouraged to contact the Office of Human Resource Management (hrm@lsua.edu). HCM Contact Information: Questions or concerns can be directed to the LSU Human Resources Management Office at 318-473-6401 or emailed hrm@lsua.edu

title: IT Support
description: Broadcast IT Specialist WDSU-TV, the NBC affiliate in New Orleans, LA is looking for an IT Specialist to join our station. You will help oversee the IT operations at our station and work with a collaborative team in a fast-paced environment. The IT Specialist reports to the the Engineering Director and performs daily maintenance on computers, virtual systems, network infrastructure, printers and provides user support. Responsibilities Support user needs across all departments, including News, Creative Services, Sales and Administration Maintain imaging machines, updating firmware and managing hardware inventory Assist the IT Manager with systems upgrades and new platform deployments Provide technical guidance to end-users and mobile device support Maintain LAN/IT infrastructure, installation and support of network hardware and software Occasional travel to news bureau, transmitter and translator locations Analyze and implement corporate data back-up, disaster recovery and security procedure Requirements Working knowledge of managed network switches and architecture concepts VMWare, Cisco or Microsoft certifications preferred Prior experience with a large user base Experience in the television broadcast setting preferred Experience with networked, stand-alone printers and digital copiers Enterprise and web-based applications VPN, Cisco equipment, TCP/IP and subnets, NAS, LAN Management Communications skills and customer-service attitude Knowledge of Microsoft Windows desktop and server operating systems Higher education in technology, SBE certification or related military experience will be considered Must be able to work Holidays, Weekends and shifted hours based upon need when required Diversity Statement At Hearst Television we tell stories every day. Stories about people of all cultures, backgrounds, perspectives, and identities. That's why, behind the scenes, we believe in being an organization as diverse and varied as the audience we reach, ensuring that the content we create is more compassionate, and more representative of the communities we serve. Benefits Hearst's benefit programs are modern, flexible and designed to focus on you. As a Hearst employee, you and your spouse or partner or dependents would have access to the following benefits. Medical | Dental | Vision 401(k) matching Emotional Wellness Support Paid Time Off Paid Parental Leave LGBTQ+ Health Services Additional benefits to meet your and your family's needs Hearst Television (HTV) owns and/or operates 35 television and two radio stations serving 27 media markets across 39 states reaching over 22 million U.S. television households. HTV is recognized as one of the industry's premier broadcasting companies and has been honored with numerous awards for distinguished journalism, industry innovation, and community service. Degree Level :

title: Human Resources Manager
description: The HRIS Manager is the product owner and subject-matter-expert for human resources systems. This position oversees the HRIS operations and staff in the selection, build, testing, implementation, and administration of HR technology solutions and integrations. Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Strong understanding of software development and support methodologies; working knowledge of relational databases and complex data structure. Ability to establish, document, and maintain procedures and processes; proven proficiency in the preparation and maintenance of software documentation and test scripts. Displays a thorough understanding of essential business functions and the ability to translate business requirements into system configurations. Demonstrated ability to communicate technically complex concepts clearly and effectively to both technical and non-technical users. Strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills. Ability to provide leadership in a team-oriented, collaborative environment. Strong functional knowledge of the various HR functions such as HR, benefits, payroll and recruiting. Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Office applications, including Excel and Access. Required Education and/or Experience Bachelor's degree and three (3) years of HR systems administration experience OR High School Diploma/equivalent and five (5) years of HR systems administration experience. Three (3) years of Human Resources experience. Two (2) years of supervisory experience. One (1) year of IT implementation experience, preferably focused on HRIS systems. Preferred Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a related field/discipline from an accredited college or university. Experience with at least one (1) full life cycle software implementation, preferably a Cloud technology. Two (2) years of project management experience or Project Management certification.

title: Network Administrator
company: Jefferson Parish Employees Federal Credit Union
description: Responsible for duties similar to a Programmer of PowerOn, SQL and ERP Administration, who reviews, assesses, and develops business processes and programming in PowerOn. Focus is on the effective use of resources, both people and technology. Position is responsible for analyzing fiscal data, programs and operations and recommending programs and implementing programs in PowerOn. The position requires extensive interaction with end users to ensure that JPEFCU effectively utilizes its application investment to analyze business and user needs in Symitar, with PowerOn programming. The position provides project management throughout all phases of the implementation of the ERP system and provides support for departmental/site specific applications. The position will identify and coordinate training for end users on all business applications such Symitar, Banno, Synergy by Jack Henry. Essential Functions The list below is intended to describe the general nature of duties only. Employees shall perform other duties as assigned. · Coordinates or conducts training sessions to implement new or improved systems and procedures. · Assists departments with technical matters and in the general preparation of the Symitar data, PowerOn programs, and Synergy and Banno Data. · Assists in the development and documentation of office systems and processes and identifies opportunities for improving business processes through information systems and changes in programs for Symitar, Banno, and Synergy. · Supports staff in preparing short and long-range projections utilizing programming and analytic techniques. · Collaborate with users to understand their business needs and match available technology to those needs in order to ensure effective utilization of the JPEFCU core Symitar application. · Increases productivity by developing automated accounting applications; coordinating information requirements to produce reports and modifications in the core system to benefit JPEFCU overall operational requirements. · Guides programming process by establishing and monitoring standards; explaining processes and techniques, recommending actions. · Recommends actions by analyzing and interpreting data and making comparative analyses; studying proposed programming changes in methods and materials to support JPEFCU requirements. · Assists in identifying areas where existing software installations require change or new ones need to be procured and adapted and makes recommendations in these areas. · Establish expertise in report writing tools, document report requests, and develop reports as appropriate. · Plan, schedule, coordinate, and conduct activities related to an application upgrade to ensure minimal disruption of application availability. Job Specifications · Bachelor’s degree in related field required. Applicants with 8 or more years of related service will be given credit for meeting the minimum educational requirements and will be considered for the position. PowerOn and SQL Querying fundamental and advanced training preferred. Experience working in the financial environment and knowledge of Jack Henry Symitar is referred. Experience managing programming in PowerOn or similar programming. Knowledge of general business processes is required. Knowledge of emerging industry practices when solving business solutions. Knowledge of typical office applications including Microsoft Office applications. Ability to troubleshoot and demonstrate analytical/problem solving skills. Ability to be organized and prioritize multiple tasks. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with co-workers, Ability to work independently with limited supervision. Ability to communicate with and understand the needs of non-technical users. Support existing ODBC connections and create new ODBC connections to assist with data analysis and create new programs in PowerOn and modify existing programs. May be required to adjust schedule to meet organizational needs, including evenings, weekends & holidays. Ability to perform the essential duties. Job Type: Full-time Pay: From $50,896.00 per year Benefits: Flexible spending account Life insurance Retirement plan Tuition reimbursement Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Work Location: In person

title: Network Administrator
description: Job Summary: This position is responsible for supporting various hardware/software projects and equipment including server hardware, operating systems and applications, storage , network hardware, and associated cable plant Duties and Responsibilities: Supporting server hardware and software infrastructure Supporting internet applications including firewall/proxy, Office 365 Suite, www, cloud storage Undertaking routine preventative measures and implementing, maintaining, and monitoring network security Administration and support of Office 365 Suite such as Microsoft Teams, One Drive, Exchange, SharePoint, Azure Active Directory Managing Active Directory user and computer accounts, groups, permissions, and privileges Supporting routed/switched networks across multiple sites and with centralized internet connectivity Performing routine preventive maintenance and disaster recovery procedures including backup/restore Analyzing and resolving hardware, software and network faults Working closely with other departments/organizations and collaborating with other IT staff Planning and implementing future IT developments and undertaking project work Education and Experience: 4 Year College degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or Business Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Administration or equivalent experience with one or more IT certifications, MCSE, CCNA and CompTIA Security+ preferred. Able to manage multiple concurrent projects and tasks. Windows Server OS, with Active Directory and associated server applications. IBM Server Hardware and Storage Technologies including fiber channel. VMware Networked peripheral devices, such as printers, audio/visual and mobile devices. Strong communication skills, ability to interact with end users. VMWare/Hyper-V Administration Cisco Network Administration Effective and professional written and verbal communication Work Environment: Click or tap here to enter text. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate as the employee works in an office setting, at an individual work station, using telephone and computer Physical Demands: Click or tap here to enter text. Must be able to remain in a stationary position for most of the day Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a printer/copy machine This position needs to occasionally move about inside the office The person in this position frequently communicates via telephone Avenu Summary: Avenu provides local governments with ways to achieve more predictable revenue that supports growth, fuels modernization and ensures compliance with mandated but underfunded programs. Avenu’s revenue enhancement and administrative solutions find and recover license, permit and other taxes that cities and counties struggle to collect. The insights and improved fiscal posture enables governments to deliver expected services and sustain a high quality of life for residents. Avenu is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Selection for a position will be made without regard to race, religion, national origin, sex, political affiliation, marital status, non-disqualifying physical handicap, and age.

title: Senior Systems Administrator
description: All Job Postings will close at 12:01a.m. CST (1:01a.m. EST) on the specified Closing Date (if designated). If you close the browser or exit your application prior to submitting, the application progress will be saved as a draft. You will be able to access and complete the application through “My Draft Applications” located on your Candidate Home page. Job Posting Title: Systems Administrator (Facility Services)- Analyst 2 or Analyst 3 Position Type: Professional / Unclassified Department: LSUAM FA - FPO - FOP - Information Technology (Michael Henderson (00059992)) Work Location: 0130E Facility Srvcs Central Shop Pay Grade: Professional Job Description: Eligible for hybrid work schedule. Opportunities for department-funded professional development. $55,600 - $66,800 System Administrator 2 (Data Analyst 2) $64,300 - $77,200 System Administrator 3 (Data Analyst 3) System Administrator- Analyst 2 The Data Analyst will perform Systems Administration duties. Those duties will include but are not limited to, administering and assisting with developing, enhancing, maintaining, and protecting a wide range of mission-critical systems within Facilities Property Oversight that support institutional processes across campus. The Data Analyst will maintain and develop relationships with ITS and external vendors. The Data Analyst will provide suggestions and analysis of new technologies that allow I.T. to better support end users and do our jobs more efficiently. Job Duties: 50%- System Administration (Windows Server 2016, 2019, and Linux): (Perform with some assistance) OS deployment\configuration and Performance Monitoring of VMs Assist in Planning and Migration of application servers and file servers due to OS EOL Implementation of ITS Security mitigation recommendations for legacy EOL OS servers Assist in the management and creation of print server printers Manage File permissions and DFS shares according to industry best practices Use Powershell scripting for automation and reporting Manage PC Inventory application OCS Inventory (Linux) Assist in Planning and implementation of Application upgrades Resolve issues as they arise through research, creation of solutions if needed, testing, and implement of solutions Active Directory Management Security Group management Clean up of stale computer records Assist with Group Policy creation and management Support third-party application server contractors (JCI, Onsite, etc.) Database administration for application databases (SimpleK, TCP, Metasys, BC, etc.) Assist with Creating\Updating server documentation 20%- Desktop OS and Application Deployment: (Perform with some assistance) Windows OS deployment Assist with Image creation and maintenance Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) task scripting Windows 10 updates troubleshooting Application deployment Assist with Creation of custom application packages using PDQ software Powershell scripting for automation Microsoft Office\O365 15%- Network and Security: (Perform with some assistance) Bluecat DNS\IP Reservation management SSL Security Certificate management Server Security patch updates and troubleshooting Monitor and resolve Server\Desktop security issues identified by weekly ITS Security Center Vulnerability scans 10%- Desktop Support: Serve as a backup for desktop support analyst 5%- Other Duties as assigned: Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree and two years of experience in Windows Server, Active Directory, and Windows OS troubleshooting skills. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree and six years of experience in Windows Server, Linux, Active Directory, VMware, and Database administration. WDS\MDT configuration, Powershell scripting, SSL Certificate management, Windows Security protocols, TCP/IP troubleshooting, working knowledge of Change Management principles, and advanced troubleshooting skills. Systems Administrator- Analyst 3 The Data Analyst will perform Systems Administration duties. Those duties will include but are not limited to, administering, developing, enhancing, maintaining, and protecting a wide range of mission-critical systems within Facilities Property Oversight that support institutional processes across campus. The Data Analyst will maintain and develop relationships with ITS and external vendors. The Data Analyst will train I.T. staff on technology, software, and best practices. The Data Analyst will provide expert suggestions and analysis of new technologies that allow I.T. to better support end users and do our jobs more efficiently. Job Duties: 50% - System Administration (Windows Server 2016, 2019, and Linux): (Perform with no assistance) OS deployment\configuration and Performance Monitoring of VMs Planning and Migration of application servers and file servers due to OS EOL Implementation of ITS Security mitigation recommendations for legacy EOL OS servers Creation\Management of print server printers Manage File permissions and DFS shares according to industry best practices Use Powershell scripting for automation and reporting Manage PC Inventory application OCS Inventory (Linux) Plan and implement Application upgrades Resolve issues as they arise through research, creation of solutions if needed, testing, and implement of solutions Active Directory Management Use Powershell scripting for automation and reporting Manage PC Inventory application OCS Inventory (Linux) Plan and implement Application upgrades Resolve issues as they arise through research, creation of solutions if needed, testing, and implement of solutions 20% - Desktop OS and Application Deployment: (Perform with no assistance) Windows OS deployment Assist with Image creation and maintenance Microsoft Deployment Toolkit (MDT) task scripting Windows 10 updates troubleshooting Application deployment Creation of custom application packages using PDQ software Powershell scripting for automation Microsoft Office\O365 15%-Network and Security: (Perform with no assistance) Bluecat DNS\IP Reservation management SSL Security Certificate management Server Security patch updates and troubleshooting Monitor and resolve Server\Desktop security issues identified by weekly ITS Security Center Vulnerability scans 10%- Desktop Support: Serve as a backup for desktop support analyst 5%- Other Duties as assigned. Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree with three years of experience in Windows Server, Active Directory, and Windows OS troubleshooting skills. Preferred Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree with ten years of experience in Windows Server, Linux, Active Directory, VMware, and Database administration. WDS\MDT configuration, Powershell scripting, SSL Certificate management, Windows Security protocols, TCP/IP troubleshooting, working knowledge of Change Management principles, and advanced troubleshooting skills. Minimum License: Valid Drivers License LSU is committed to creating an inclusive space where our employees feel valued for their skills and uniqueness. If you do not meet the minimum qualifications as listed but have significant experience within the primary job responsibilities, we welcome your application. Special/Physical Qualifications Due to the nature of this position and/or position responsibilities, this position shall be subject to drug/alcohol testing in accordance with University Policy Statement 67. In accordance with PS-18, this position may be required to report or stay on campus in the event of emergency or closure. Due to the position's physical requirements, a pre-employment physical examination will be required per FASOP: HR-04. Additional Job Description: Special Instructions: Please provide a resume and three (3) professional references, including name, title, phone number and e-mail address. Please attach ALL required documents under the "Resume/CV" section of your application. A copy of your transcript(s) may be attached to your application (if available). However, original transcripts are required prior to hire. For questions or concerns regarding the status of your application or salary ranges, please contact Michael Henderson at mhenderson1@lsu.edu Posting Date: November 8, 2023 Closing Date (Open Until Filled if No Date Specified): Additional Position Information: Background Check - An offer of employment is contingent on a satisfactory pre-employment background check. Benefits - LSU offers outstanding benefits to eligible employees and their dependents including health, life, dental, and vision insurance; flexible spending accounts; retirement options; various leave options; paid holidays; wellness benefits; tuition exemption for qualified positions; training and development opportunities; employee discounts; and more! Remote Work - Positions approved to work remotely outside the State of Louisiana shall be employed through Louisiana State University’s partner, nextSource Workforce Solutions, for Employer of Record Services including but not limited to employment, benefits, payroll, and tax compliance. Positions employed through Employer of Record Services will be offered benefits and retirement as applicable through their provider and will not be eligible for State of Louisiana benefits and retirement.
